abstract.p: New marquee and facade on John Harms Center for Arts in Englewood, NJ, is unveiled (S)

block.p: The marquee and the facade of the John Harms Center for the Arts in Englewood has a new look -- and the people who paid for it had their names up in lights for an afternoon.
The marquee and the facade of the John Harms Center for the Arts in Englewood has a new look -- and the people who paid for it had their names up in lights for an afternoon.

The marquee was unveiled on Wednesday starring Citibank, which contributed $100,000 for the state-of-the-art electronic marquee; Bergen County, which contributed $170,000 through the community development block program for renovations to the facade, and Lincoln, the automobile company, the official sponsor of the 2000-2001 season.
There were also electronic fireworks on the new marquee of the 1,400-seat theater, which first opened in 1926 as the Plaza, a silent movie and vaudeville theater.
Frank De Micco, president of the John Harms Board of Trustees, said the current renovation ''celebrates the spirit of cooperation between the public, private and not-for-profit sectors.''
